mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Hopes that Short received the $750 bank note; the balance of the debt is now $793.93 which Jefferson hopes to send to Short on July 6th if Short will still be in New York; "Carter's deed" was turned into the courthouse and most likely recorded by now; the second cask of Cahusac has been shipped up the river, but only before it went to Guadalupe; wants more bottles from Madame de la Rochefoucault; asks Short to make this request and give Jefferson's regards to Madame de la Rochefoucault.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1807 June 14, Washington, [D.C.] to [William] Short, n.p.
